comments.text:
This probably happens on all platforms, but the steps below are for Windows.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Login as administrator and create a file on your C:\ or a UNC path.
2. Remove write permission, but keep read permissions on the file.
3. Login as a Limited user account.
4. Try to save a file to the location of the file in step one.
5. The download manager will return success as if nothing went wrong.

Actual results:
You will notice that a file in the same directory exists named 5aHedm5E.part
The download window says that it was downloaded successfully though.

Expected results:
There should be an error message that the file couldn't be downloaded properly.

Other ways to reproduce:
You can also reproduce this as well if there are sharing violations, i.e. a file is opened with read sharing flag but not write sharing flag and then you try to save to it with Firefox.
